headline: Medtronic Announces Separation From Diabetes Business, CEO Says it’s “In a Really Good Spot”
summary: On Wednesday, Medtronic (NYSE:MDT) announced its intention to separate its diabetes business into a new, standalone company, to enhance focus on high-margin growth drivers for Medtronic and accelerate innovation for the new entity. The diabetes unit, which manufactures insulin pumps and other wearable devices, has recently returned to growth after struggling for several years due […]

headline: TD Cowen Keeps a Buy on Medtronic (MDT) After Better Growth in Q4
summary: Josh Jennings, an analyst from TD Cowen, reiterated a Buy rating on Medtronic plc (NYSE:MDT) with an unchanged price target of $95. The analyst viewed FQ4 2025 results favourably as the company managed to post an organic sales growth of 5.4%, ahead of street expectations of 4.6%. The analyst highlighted the strength of Medtronic’s strategy […]

headline: Abbott vs. Medtronic: Which Dividend-Paying MedTech Stock is Better?
summary: With both MDT & ABT focusing on their core strengths, the stage is set for a compelling comparison. Let's see which stock is poised for greater upside.

headline: Why Medtronic plans to spin out its diabetes business
summary: While some analysts questioned why Medtronic would leave a fast-growing market, others backed the company’s plan to focus on segments with higher margins.

headline: Medtronic still hiding behind its status as a dividend aristocrat
summary: The world leader in medical equipment is a master in the art of making announcements; in the absence of objective economic performance, it certainly knows how to appease its shareholders.
